intro: Hemizonia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its opposite arrangement of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Hemizonia oppositifolia is often found in open woodlands and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
